text: His Majesty's Prison Wakefield is a Category A prison for men in Wakefield in England. Category A means that the prison is for the most dangerous criminals. It was built in 1594. It has about 740 prisoners. Harold Shipman was a prisoner there until he committed suicide in 2004. Ian Watkins was also a prisoner there. ==References== Category:1590s establishments in England Category:Buildings and structures in West Yorkshire Category:Prisons in England Category:Wakefield
title: HM Prison Wakefield
